Docs.summary: Provides the base implementation of the retry mechanism for unreliable actions and transient conditions.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy DefaultExponential { get; }

Public Shared ReadOnly Property DefaultExponential As RetryPolicy
member this.DefaultExponential : Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy

Docs.summary: Returns a default policy that implements a random exponential retry interval configured with the default retry strategy. The default retry policy treats all caught exceptions as transient errors.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task ExecuteAsync (Func<System.Threading.Tasks.Task> taskAction);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task ExecuteAsync(class System.Func`1<class System.Threading.Tasks.Task> taskAction) cil managed
Public Function ExecuteAsync (taskAction As Func(Of Task)) As Task
member this.ExecuteAsync : Func<System.Threading.Tasks.Task> -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.param: A function that returns a started task (also known as "hot" task).
Docs.summary: Repetitively executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.
Docs.returns: A task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will transition to a faulted state and the exception must be observed.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task ExecuteAsync (Func<System.Threading.Tasks.Task> taskAction, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken);

.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task ExecuteAsync(class System.Func`1<class System.Threading.Tasks.Task> taskAction, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
member this.ExecuteAsync : Func<System.Threading.Tasks.Task> * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.param: A function that returns a started task (also known as "hot" task).
The token used to cancel the retry operation. This token does not cancel the execution of the asynchronous task.
Docs.summary: Repetitively executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.
Docs.returns: Returns a task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will transition to a faulted state and the exception must be observed.

Docs.param: A function that returns a started task (also known as "hot" task).
Docs.summary: Repeatedly executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.
Docs.returns: Returns a task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will transition to a faulted state and the exception must be observed.

Docs.param: A function that returns a started task (also known as "hot" task).
The token used to cancel the retry operation. This token does not cancel the execution of the asynchronous task.
Docs.summary: Repeatedly executes the specified asynchronous task while it satisfies the current retry policy.
Docs.returns: Returns a task that will run to completion if the original task completes successfully (either the first time or after retrying transient failures). If the task fails with a non-transient error or the retry limit is reached, the returned task will transition to a faulted state and the exception must be observed.
